results.title: The Marist way
results.brief_description: Locally produced documentary promoting the virtues of the monastic life, and teaching methods practise by the Marist Order. The film details the rigorous regime of scholastic, spiritual and athletic training the Brothers apply to their words in boarding schools across Australia. In conclusion, it asks which of their charges will assume their monastic vocation.

results.title: It's up to us
results.brief_description: The Intellectual Disability Rights service have produced this video to help disabled people to deal with rights and responsibilities at work. It includes issues such as safety, sexual harrassment, the right to be treated fairly, the right to choose your own friends and to have relationships. The second section looks at why people may want a workers committee and how one group of workers set one up.

results.title: Amongst equals
results.creator_credit: Tom Zubrycki, Paul Hamfess and Jotz Productions
results.brief_description: Documents the history of the Australian Trade Union Movement. The film is not endorsed by the ACTU and represents only the film maker’s view. The 1850s saw the introduction of the eight hour labour movement and the subsequent development of the trade union movement. Unions were established to organise, assert and defend the worker’s rights, industrial awards, occupational health and safety and minimum wages.

results.title: The Madigan Line
results.brief_description: One of the most inhospitable and desolate regions on Earth, the Simpson Desert was to fight off many challenges to penetrate its seemingly impenetrable heart. Expedition after expedition tried and failed. Men died but still they came. This video faithfully reenacts the 1939 expedition of Dr. Cecil Madigan who successfully crossed Australias last frontier.

holdings.name: VHS; Access Print (Section 1)

results.title: The Bad society
results.brief_description: In December 1976, 16,000 people converged at the Cotter River in Canberra for the “Down to earth” festival; a conference on alternative lifestyles. In attendance were Reverend George Davies, Dr. Jim Cairns, Dr. Jim Falk as well as thousands of counter culture followers. This documentary explores the festival and the themes of politics and social change. The Philisophy of Ex Deputy Prime Minister, Dr. Jim Cairns is particularly focussed on with its emphasis on how a nation state creates a ‘bad society’ and how communal life and a counter culture lifestyle forms the only radicalism against society.

results.title: Tramways
results.creator_credit: Leonie Dickinson, Michael Bau and Gunzel
results.brief_description: A warm hearted look at the people of Melbourne, their trams and their passion. Delves into the fascination with a mode of transport that carries passengers in the 19990’s on 1930’s vehicles.

results.title: Neat on Paper
results.creator_credit: James Kesteven, Mandy King, Miriana Marusic and Sydney Filmmakers' Co-op Action Group
results.brief_description: The Sydney Filmmakers’ Co-operative was a major national agency for the distribution and exhibition of independently produced Australian film and video for over 20 years. This program examines the issues surrounding its closure in 1986.

results.title: Homosexuality: a film for discussion
results.brief_description: Designed to dispel the myths about homosexuality. Homosexuals talk about their lives, their relationships and the difficulties of growing up gay in an oppressive, intolerant society. Parents of gays speak out and the Melbourne public expresses its view on the subject.

results.title: The Life of Harry Dare
results.creator_credit: Aleski Vellis, Terry J. Charatsis, Australian Film Commission, Infinity Pictures and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Harry Dare’s troubles began the day he sighted the Kombi van and despite the warnings of ‘Bad Spirit Trouble’, he just had to have it. When the van is stolen, Harry embarks on a journey with his young estranged son Jim to find it. What Harry really discovers is a more meaningful relationship with his son. Stars John Moore as Harry and Aaron Wilton as Jim.

results.title: Boys and Balls
results.creator_credit: Sue Thomson, Anna Grieve, Film Finance Corporation Australia, Gil Scrine Films and Thermal Falls
results.brief_description: It is in games many men discover their paradise. Robert Lynd. H.G. Nelson (Greig Pickhaver) and Rampaging Roy Slaven (John Doyle) host an amusing, often hilarious exploration of the fascination of men with balls; whether it is a cricket, football, tennis, basketball, soccer, bowls, table tennis, hockey or golf ball! Celebrities including Ted Whitten, Ron Barassi, Merv Hughes, Derek Kickett, Andrew Gaze, Lindsay Gaze, Francis Awaritife, Brad Mackay, Greg Champion and the average bloke and kid next door share favourite childhood memories of their sporting idols, humerous moments, coaching temperaments, the importance of rules and umpiring, and the incidence of sporting violence. Interviews, archival footage and famous quotes are intermixed in this perceptive program.
